snippet: The Romany arrived in Europe from northern India 1,500 years ago.
abstract: The Romany arrived in Europe from northern India 1,500 years ago.
lead_paragraph: A new genetic study suggests the ancestors of Europe’s Romany people “arrived in Europe from northwestern India in a single wave around 1,500 years ago, half a millennium earlier than previously thought,” Harvey Morris wrote in the International Herald Tribune’s Rendezvous blog. “The international authors of the peer-reviewed paper in the journal Current Biology said their study was the most comprehensive ever of the demographic history of the Romany,” he wrote. headline.main: Romany Were European 500 Years Earlier Than Previously Thought
